articles.author: Shristi A, Amruta Khandekar
articles.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq fell on Thursday with Apple leading declines in megacap growth stocks on concerns over China's iPhone curbs, while a fall in weekly jobless claims stoked worries about sticky inflation.
articles.title: S&P, Nasdaq fall as Apple drags, jobless claims data fuels rate jitters

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: Ryan Salame, the former co-CEO of FTX's Bahamian subsidiary and a top lieutenant to the cryptocurrency exchange's founder Sam Bankman-Fried, has agreed to plead guilty to conspiring to make unlawful contributions and defraud the Federal Election commission, Salame said on Thursday.
articles.title: Ex-FTX executive Salame agrees to plead guilty to US criminal charges, lawyer says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Artemis holding company of French luxury goods billionaire Francois-Henri Pinault has reached an agreement for a majority stake in Hollywood talent agency Creative Artists Agency (CAA), the parties involved said on Thursday.
articles.title: French billionaire Pinault seals deal for Hollywood agency CAA

articles.author: Hadeel Sayegh, Andres Gonzalez, Belén Carreño
articles.description: Jose Maria Alvarez-Pallete, chairman and chief executive of debt laden Spanish telephone and internet service company Telefonica, got an unexpected call this week when he was in Silicon Valley to meet companies and investors in America's tech capital.
articles.title: Focus: How the Saudis became a top shareholder in Telefonica, Spain's telecoms giant

articles.author: Helen Coster, Zaheer Kachwala
articles.description: News Corp (NWSA.O) is engaged in "various negotiations" with artificial intelligence companies over their use of its content, the company's chief executive said at an investor conference Thursday, adding it does not plan to pursue legal action against them at this stage.
articles.title: News Corp in negotiations with AI companies over content usage - CEO

articles.author: David Shepardson
articles.description: General Motors said Thursday it has offered workers a 10% wage hike and two additional 3% annual lump sum payments over four years in its offer to the United Auto Workers union ahead of the Sept. 14 contract expiration.
articles.title: GM offers 10% wage hike in UAW contract talks

articles.author: Jonathan Stempel
articles.description: General Motors (GM.N) was ordered by a federal appeals court on Thursday to defend against claims by a Black safety supervisor, who said she endured years of racism and sexism at an upstate New York plant where other workers displayed Confederate flags and nooses.
articles.title: GM employee's racial bias lawsuit is revived over NY plant where nooses were displayed

articles.author: Lucy Papachristou, Filipp Lebedev
articles.description: Timofei Rudenko can't seem to stay out of jail.
articles.title: The critics of Russia's war in Ukraine caught in jail 'carousel'

articles.author: Julie Zhu, Kevin Yao
articles.description: China has in recent weeks widened existing curbs on the use of iPhones by state employees, telling staff at some central government agencies to stop using their Apple (AAPL.O) mobiles at work, two sources familiar with the matter said.
articles.title: China moves to widen state employee iPhone curbs

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: More than 150 rescuers raced on Thursday to reach an American man who fell ill and became trapped some 1,000 metres (3,280 ft) underground in a cave he was exploring in southern Turkey.
articles.title: Rescuers race to save ill US cave explorer trapped 3,000 feet underground
